Sánchez atribueix al cansament les paraules sobre la Fiscalia: "És autònoma"
El president del govern espanyol en funcions rectifica, diu que "no vaig ser precís" i ho atribueix al cansament de la campanya electoral
07 Nov 2019, 12:11 by Juli Rodés Almer
El president del govern espanyol en funcions, Pedro Sánchez, ha rectificat aquest migdia les seves controvertides declaracions de dimecres al matí que donaven per feta la dependència de la Fiscalia del poder executiu.
"La Fiscalia, el nomenament depèn del govern d'Espanya, però és autònoma."
Al cap de poc més de 24 hores de parlar a RNE i tres dies abans de les eleccions, Sánchez ha dit que "s'ha de ser humil" i ha reconegut que es va equivocar.
Ho ha atribuït al cansament causat per la campanya electoral del 10N:
"La veritat és que no vaig ser precís en la declaració que vaig fer ahir. Són moltes entrevistes, moltes hores davant d'un micròfon, davant d'una pantalla; de vegades no s'és precís."
En una entrevista en el programa "Al rojo vivo" de La Sexta, Sánchez ha fet una defensa aferrissada del seu respecte a la independència de la Fiscalia i del poder judicial:
"Fins i tot em contraria una mica, quan he estat un president del govern -i també el meu govern- que ha respectat tant l'autonomia de la Fiscalia com la independència del poder judicial." "El que vaig voler dir, i per això vull ser molt precís, és que no hi ha ningú per sobre de la llei, que hi ha una sentència del Tribunal Suprem que clarament assenyala líders independentistes que ara estan fugits de la justícia espanyola, i que en un estat social i democràtic de dret, el poder executiu es compromet a ajudar tant la Fiscalia com el poder judicial a fer que aquests líders independentistes tornin a Espanya i rendeixin comptes a la justícia."
I encara ha reiterat: "La Fiscalia té tota la meva confiança i tota la confiança del govern".
L'origen de les declaracions de Sánchez a RNE estan en la promesa que va fer dilluns, durant el debat electoral a cinc entre els principals candidats a la presidència del govern espanyol, que portaria a Espanya l'expresident Carles Puigdemont.
 




Al cap de més de 24 hores, Pedro Sánchez ha rectificat les polèmiques declaracions sobre la Fiscalia (EFE/Rafa Alcaide)

 
En concret, va retreure a Pablo Casado, president del PP, que els fugís Puigdemont i va afegir: "Em comprometo avui i aquí a tornar-lo a Espanya i que rendeixi comptes davant la justícia espanyola."
Preguntat per aquesta frase, Sánchez hi ha tret ferro tot dient: "Són expressions que s'utilitzen en els debats electorals."
I ha volgut aclarir:
"El que vaig voler dir és el compromís del govern d'Espanya perquè la justícia espanyola i les seves sentències es compleixin."
Les declaracions de Sánchez van generar malestar entre les associacions de fiscals, tant els conservadors com els progressistes.

Sánchez attributes tired words to the Office of the Prosecutor: "It is autonomous"
The president of the Spanish government in charge corrects, says that "I was not precise" it attributes and it to the fatigue of the electoral campaign
07 Nov 2019, 12:11 by Juli Rodés Almer
The president of the Spanish government in charge, Pedro Sánchez, rectified this midday his controversial statements on Wednesday morning that they made due to the dependence of the Prosecutor's Office of the executive branch.
"The Office of the Public Prosecutor, the appointment depends on the government of Spain, but it is autonomous."
After little more than 24 hours of talking to RNE and three days before the election, Sanchez said that "it must be humble" and recognized that it was wrong.
It is attributed to the tiredness caused by the 10N election campaign:
"The truth is that I was not precise in the statement that I made yesterday. There are many interviews, many hours before a microphone, in front of a screen, sometimes it is not precise."
In an interview in the "Al rojo vivo" program of La Sexta, Sánchez has made a fierce defense of his respect for the independence of the Prosecutor's Office and the judiciary:
"I even oppose a bit, when I have been a president of the government - and also my government - that has respected both the autonomy of the Office of the Prosecutor and the independence of the judiciary." "What I meant, and that is why I want to be very precise, is that there is no one above the law, that there is a ruling of the Supreme Court that clearly indicates independentist leaders who are now fled from Spanish justice, and that in a social and democratic state of law, executive power commits itself to help both the Prosecutor General and the judiciary to make these independent leaders return to Spain and render accounts to justice. "
And he still reiterated: "The Prosecutor's Office has all my confidence and all the confidence of the government."
The origin of Sánchez's statements to RNE are in the promise he made Monday during the electoral debate to five among the main candidates for the presidency of the Spanish government, which would bring to Spain the former president Carles Puigdemont.





After more than 24 hours, Pedro Sánchez has rectified the controversial statements about the Prosecutor's Office (EFE / Rafa Alcaide)


In particular, he thanked Pablo Casado, president of the PP, that Puigdemont fled and added: "I commit myself today and here to return to Spain and pay tribute to the Spanish courts."
Asked about this phrase, Sánchez said: "They are expressions that are used in the electoral debates."
And he wanted to clarify:
"What I wanted to say is the commitment of the government of Spain because the Spanish justice and its sentences are fulfilled."
Sánchez's statements generated an upset among the fiscal associations, both conservatives and progressives.
